alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cheyenne and southeastern Kimball Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 714 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southeast of Kimball Airport, or 12 miles southeast of Kimball, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Cheyenne and southeastern Kimball Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
